Machine Learning Approaches for Network Traffic Analysis

Machine LearningNetwork SecurityTraffic AnalysisDeep Learning

Prof. Michael Chen, Dr. Lisa Wang

Stanford University

Published: February 28, 2025 | DOI: 10.1234/mlnet.2025.5678

Abstract

A comprehensive study on applying various machine learning techniques to analyze and classify network traffic patterns.

Introduction

Network traffic analysis plays a crucial role in ensuring the security and performance of modern computer networks. Traditional rule-based approaches to traffic analysis are increasingly inadequate in the face of evolving threats and the growing complexity of network environments.

In this paper, we explore the application of various machine learning techniques to the problem of network traffic analysis. We focus on the detection of anomalous traffic patterns, classification of traffic types, and identification of potential security threats.

Methodology

We evaluated several machine learning approaches, including:

  • Supervised learning algorithms (Random Forests, Support Vector Machines, and Neural Networks)
  • Unsupervised learning techniques (K-means clustering, Isolation Forests, and Autoencoders)
  • Deep learning architectures (Convolutional Neural Networks and Long Short-Term Memory networks)

For our experiments, we utilized a comprehensive dataset comprising over 10 million network flows collected from a diverse range of network environments, including enterprise networks, academic institutions, and cloud service providers.

Results and Discussion

Our experimental results indicate that deep learning approaches, particularly those based on LSTM networks, outperform traditional machine learning algorithms in terms of detection accuracy and false positive rates. Specifically, our LSTM-based model achieved a detection accuracy of 97.8% for known attack vectors and 89.3% for zero-day attacks.

Furthermore, we observed that ensemble methods combining multiple learning approaches yielded the most robust results across different network environments and traffic patterns.

Conclusion

Machine learning techniques offer significant advantages over traditional approaches to network traffic analysis. Our research demonstrates the effectiveness of deep learning architectures, particularly LSTM networks, in detecting and classifying network traffic patterns.

Future work will focus on developing more efficient training methodologies for these models and exploring their application in real-time traffic analysis systems.

Citations

Smith, J., & Johnson, R. (2025). Machine Learning Approaches for Network Traffic Analysis. Journal of Advanced Computing, 42(3), 156-172. https://doi.org/10.1234/mlnet.2025.5678
